section.title: Concept Details
section.para: A Concept represents a clinical meaning. Each Concept has descriptions that describe the concept, relationships that relate concepts to eachother, and OWL axioms that provide a logical definition to the concept. The logical definition (axiom) is used by the Classifier to infer additional relationships between concepts – this is the inferred axiom.

In Concept Details a user can view concept information, modify display options, create a child concept, edit the concept, clone the concept, view value set membership, and display history of a concept. When a user selects a concept from the taxonomy, search results, or the briefcase concept this information is displayed in the Concept Details pane, refer to .
The sections below describe the concept information displayed, and the functions available in the Concept Details pane.

section.title: Actions
section.para:
There are several actions available in Concept Details pane:
Link – the Concept Details pane can be "linked" with the Taxonomy or "unlinked" by toggling the linkage icon
New Child Concept – a new concept is created that is the child of the concept displayed.
Edit Concept – enables the displayed concept to be modified.
Clone – copies the displayed concept to a new concept template.
Display Options - changes the display options for the Concept Details pane, refer to .
Close – closes the Concept Details pane.
Context Menu – the Context Menu is also available in Concept Details by right-clicking on the concept name in the upper left, see . For a description of the functions available in the Context Menu, refer to

section.title: General Info
section.para:
The General Info area has three sections: concept properties, descriptions and axiom. This view is configured with default display options
See . :
Concept Properties
Concept Type – primitive or defined, refer to
Status – defines whether the concept is active or inactive
Module – identifies which module the concept belongs in e.g. a SNOMED CT concept is in SNOMED CT core module
ID - if the concept is a SNOMED concept then the SCTID is displayed. If the conccept is a LOINC term the the LOINC ID is displayed.
Fully Qualified Name (FQN) – human readable unique word or phrase which represents clinical meaning.
Regular Name – is a term of a specified type that describes the concept. A concept can have more than one Regular Name.

mediaobject.alt: Figure of the Concept Details pane.

section.para: The pane lists the general concept information such as STAMP (define STAMP), its descriptions which include additional names it may be known by in other languages and dialects, and the axiom history which illustrates its taxonomy relationship. Details such as the inferred information or inactive items can be toggled on by selecting "Display options" in the upper right corner, and its refset relationships and history can be found in tabs within the same panel.

inlinemediaobject.alt: Figure of the Display Options modal from the Concept Details. Displays options such as "Show authors, language, modules, filter STAMP date," and more.

section.para: Optionally another Concept Details pane can be opened and will display on the far right side of the window. There are three alternatives to open another Concept Details:

listitem.para: Right-click the concept you wish to review and select "open in new Concept Details".
Highlight the concept you want to see in a new viewer and press "keyboard shortcut tbd, e.g. ctrl+alt+n " to open a new Concept Details.
In the top navigation pane, select "Authoring", then "Launch Third View".
